title: Update Changelog
body: Preparing the next alpha version

title: Remove unnecessary dead_code markers
body:
This is not `dead_code` any more, since this field is used.

Closes #75

title: Require new version of rusqlite
body:
Changes the minimal supported `rusqlite` version to `0.29.0`. 

Closes #69

title: Replace BTreeMap with Vec
body:
Implements the performance improvements described in #85 i.e. replacing the `BTreeMap` with a `Vec` of `Option`.

Closes #85.

title: Improve edit api
body:
This PR implements my take on #86. The edit api now takes ownership of the migration it edits.


Closes #86

title: Fix ConnectionClosed mapping
body: Fix ConnectionClosed mapping when `async-tokio-rusqlite` is disabled.

title: doc: make the deps badge more accurate
body:
Currently, we report on the status of the dependencies in the dev
version (i.e. the lastest master commit of the GitHub repository). This
a bit misleading, because users of the library usually pull the latest
stable and use it. Whether dependencies are up to date for the latest
stable is quite different from the dev version.

This updated URL reports on the latest version. The drawback is that one
has to manually update the path when a new stable version is released.

title: chore(deps): update criterion requirement from 0.4 to 0.5

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [criterion](https://github.com/bheisler/criterion.rs) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from criterion's changelog.

[0.5.0] - 2023-05-23

Changed

  • Replaced lazy_static dependency with once_cell
  • Improved documentation of the html_reports feature
  • Replaced atty dependency with is-terminal
  • MSRV bumped to 1.64
  • Upgraded clap dependency to v4
  • Upgraded tempfile dependency to v3.5.0

Fixed

  • Quick mode (--quick) no longer outputs 1ms for measured times over 5 seconds
  • Documentation updates

[0.4.0] - 2022-09-10

Removed

  • The Criterion::can_plot function has been removed.
  • The Criterion::bench_function_over_inputs function has been removed.
  • The Criterion::bench_functions function has been removed.
  • The Criterion::bench function has been removed.

Changed

  • HTML report hidden behind non-default feature flag: 'html_reports'
  • Standalone support (ie without cargo-criterion) feature flag: 'cargo_bench_support'
  • MSRV bumped to 1.57
  • rayon and plotters are optional (and default) dependencies.
  • Status messages ('warming up', 'analyzing', etc) are printed to stderr, benchmark results are printed to stdout.
  • Accept subsecond durations for --warm-up-time, --measurement-time and --profile-time.
  • Replaced serde_cbor with ciborium because the former is no longer maintained.
  • Upgrade clap to v3 and regex to v1.5.

Added

  • A --discard-baseline flag for discarding rather than saving benchmark results.
  • Formal support for benchmarking code compiled to web-assembly.
  • A --quiet flag for printing just a single line per benchmark.
  • A Throughput::BytesDecimal option for measuring throughput in bytes but printing them using decimal units like kilobytes instead of binary units like kibibytes.

Fixed

  • When using bench_with_input, the input parameter will now be passed through black_box before passing it to the benchmark.

[0.3.6] - 2022-07-06

Changed

  • MSRV bumped to 1.49
  • Symbol for microseconds changed from ASCII 'us' to unicode 'µs'

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 4a560cb release version 0.5 (#683)
  • 3e2849e Post v0.4 CHANGELOG updates (#680)
  • 637010e Bump clap to version 4 (#679)
  • 39d7e2f Update to tempfile 3.5 (#675)
  • 8ab2752 Fix typo in known_limitations.md (#674)
  • a211230 chore: replace atty with is-terminal (#628)
  • a844eb2 Bump MSRV to 1.60 for csv dependency (#665)
  • 2f53607 Use OR operator to specify multiple licenses (#643)
  • 86dcd7d Fix bug where time over the maximum would be reported as 1ms in quick mode. (...
  • 2942aee Remove unnecessary pub from example code (#657)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: Migrate to the newest tokio-rusqlite
body: Migrate `tokio-rusqlite` to the newest version handling the new `ConnectionClosed` error condition.

title: fix: fix some clippy pedantic warnings
refactor!: deprecate `Migrations::from_iter`
body: We are now implementing the standard `FromIterator` trait.

title: Add benchmarks
body: These benchmarks are a work in progress, they are not stable enough yet and they have quite a lot of quirks. They can still be usefull to assess the impact of some changes, combined with other measurements.

title: Documentation improvements
body: Toughen up the CI checks and make the necessary fixes

title: refactor: improve the performance of from_directory
body:
Limit intermediary allocations (remove one intermediary `Vec` allocation
in particular) and generally try to limit the computation performed.

Fixes #76

title: doc: add changelog entry for 1.0.2
body: Cherry picking the changelog update from #70

title: refactor: misc. style and robustness improvements
body:
* A string was manually copied to create an error, so the error could
  become inaccurate as the string may become out of date.
* Use `with_sql` method when possible without incurring extra allocation
* Fix typo in documentation
* Improve some logging directive (in particular, inlining the variables)

title: doc: remove a badge from README
body: It’s super long now and it takes two lines on the homepage (https://cj.rs/rusqlite_migration/).

title: doc: explain cargo sync-readme to contributors
body:
It’s quite counter-intuitive to have to change the lib.rs file to change
the README.md file. This is now explained in the “Contributing” section
of the readme.

title: doc: make sure the README is displayed on sr.ht
body:
On sourcehut, the symlink is not followed for the main README.md file.
To have a rendered README on the project homepage on sourcehut, we need
to have a regular file at the top.

This commit fixes this and makes the nested README a symlink to the
top-level README. As far as I could test, this works nicely with `cargo
sync-readme`.

title: Create CODEOWNERS file
body: Paves the way for adding collaborators to the repository.

title: Additional async tests
body: Added some additional tests to make sure there won't be any behavior mismatches between the async and the sync versions.

title: Update GitHub actions to newer versions
test: test Eq implementations
body:
With hooks, since the address of the underlying closure is used for
comparison, it is helpful to include it in the debug output.

title: test: ensure smooth error conversion from rusqlite
Change runner to `tarpaulin`
body: Extracted just the change to `tarpaulin`.

title: Tweak coverage parameters
body:
* Remove doc-tests coverage, as we then lose the report on covered lines
  in source files by coveralls
* Exclude the module `asynch` as it is mostly tested by doc-tests, to
  ease maintainability and limit duplicated code.

title: test: attempt to use nightly test coverage in CI
Attempt to implement coverage reports
body:
Various attempts to implement coverage upload to coveralls (codecov failed to reactivate the repo).

It does not seem to work, but perhaps we need to have at least one build from a PR or the master branch?

title: Add a feature to load migrations from a directory
body:
This PR provides a new feature `from-directory` which allows to specify a directory used to load migrations from and store them in the binary.
This implementation assumes that the directory contains `*.sql` files with a documented naming pattern.

Closes #37.

### TODO:
- [x] This is a WIP PR. It is fully functional but we should merge #50, #49 and #47 before we can merge this. Afterwards the PR should be rebased on top of the `master` branch.

@cljoly feel free to have a first look and review.

title: Fix `AsyncMigrations::new` documentation
body: The documentation was incorrectly stating that this method "adapts" something, when it creates a proxy.

title: Fix example test
body: The `async` example had an incorrect test. Fixed it and also added an new CI pipeline to verify the examples so it cannot happen in the future.

title: doc: add thanks to Migadu
body:
Migadu offered discounted service as a part of their policy to support
open-source and non-profits.

title: Fix problems and improve tests according to `cargo mutants`
body:
This PR fixes problems found by mutation testing.

- [x] Asynch module is not fixed yet

Fixes #46 and #45.
Partially implements #40.

title: Fix clippy pedantic warnings
body: This PR closes #43.

title: Follow-up on clippy pedantic warnings
body:
- style: silence some clippy pedantic warnings
- docs: fix links in the example

cc @matze this builds on #38

title: Fix pedantic warnings
body: This PR fixes all warnings with `-W clippy::pedantic` except for the potential truncation/sign loss problems.

title: Update the env_logger dependency
body: Change the `env_logger` dependency to the newest version.

title: Update repository metadata
body: Add the missing `repository` metadata. This makes browsing between `crates.io`, `docs.rs` and this repo easier.

title: Add support for tokio-rusqlite

milestone.title: Version 1.1.0
milestone.description: Blocker for release of the next stable version.

body:
@cljoly please have a look and comment everything that you feel is not right. Consider it a very preliminary version.

There's a few things that are still missing:
- [x] Tests are currently just copied over from the `sync` version to the `async` version. Feels more like doctests should be considered for both versions and the main tests should be performed only on the extracted functions?
- [x] The created feature is not [additive](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/4328). I'm not sure how to make it so, maybe providing a `AsyncMigrations` struct and leaving the `Migrations` without any changes (except extracting the functions) may be a solution? What do you thing @cljoly?
- [x] Additional tests can and should be created for the extracted functions in `lib.rs`.

Closes #24.

title: Add up/down hooks to insert custom Rust code
body: Draft PR to make discussion/review a bit easier.

title: Misc. test fixes
body:
- docs: fix doc tests
- chore: fix clippy warning

title: chore(deps): update mktemp requirement from 0.4 to 0.5

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [mktemp](https://github.com/samgiles/rs-mktemp) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from mktemp's releases.

0.5.0

  • Update uuid to 1.2

  • Don't derive Clone, it will cause issues with drop - wrap in an Arc/Rc to share.

  • Don't panic if file or directory does not exist

Commits
  • cff355e Bump uuid
  • aabea64 don't panic
  • 826f604 Don't derive Clone, it will cause issues with drop
  • 124f986 Update uuid to 1.1
  • af22c7b Fix clippy lint
  • 6b79d0d Impl Debug for Temp
  • edd8cae Add code formatting tag
  • e33f819 Update UUID to 0.8
  • 4b7a0d7 Add badges.
  • 98c6dcf run cargo clippy --fix
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Minimum Rust version check in CI
body: Soft check, as rusqlite provides no msrv guarantees.

title: Add foreign_key_check method to migrations
body:
This implements a method to validate that all foreign keys are still valid after a migration as discussed in #4.
~This still lacks tests, feel free to comment on anything else.~

title: fix: error instead of panicking on higher migration level
body:
When we encounter a database whose migration number is higher than the
highest migration, we currently panic. With this change, we just return
an error.

Fixes #17
